column4: Hi all. questions for those with experience running a jam. How long do they usually last?  How long should they last at a minimum?
what state/country are you in?
I ask because the LoCo team in your area is probably going to run one.
!mintsupport > zaizafoon
Yes, they are going to run one. I'm in Iowa. I'm helping to organize it, and no one here has much experience with them.
the ubuntu-qc team is doing one let me link you.
awe cool. Didn't know the QC folks were doing one.
http://ur1.ca/ohmm there are no times but the last one was from 11-5 and 11-7
That was the quebec.  Wrong country. :)
err that was the quebec team.  I'm in Iowa.
I link as an example :) but take a look here https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuGlobalJam
if you scroll down some there will be more info on how to run a jam
Yeah, I've seen that page. But I don't see anything on there that talks about how long they usually last.
Just wanted some idea of that from folks who have been to them.
really I would say it is up to you and the people who attend, you don't want to go to many hours or you will burn out. I would say 5-6 hours per day would be good
SEMI-PROTIP keep it fun :)

IdoleOne: Thanks.  That's kinda' what I was thinking, but wasn't sure. We're going to only have one day, as were having a hard enough time trying a place to hold it just for one day, let alone more than that.
err trying to find a place.
IdoleOne: For sure. Thanks.
make sure you add your jam info to the appropriate wikis :)
Yeah, will do.
you could also ask for more advice/info in #ubuntu-locoteams
